account.title: A minha conta
account.webauthnDescription: Use YubiKey, TouchID ou Windows Hello para início sem palavra-passe
account.apiKeyWarning: Esta chave só será mostrada uma vez. Copie-a agora.
account.scanQRCode: 1. Scan this QR code with your authenticator app:
account.addHardwareKey: Add a hardware security key (YubiKey, TouchID, Windows Hello) for passwordless login.
account.useMTLSCerts: Use X.509 client certificates for mutual TLS authentication
apiKeyTips: API keys allow programmatic access to UCM
Keep your keys secret and rotate them regularly
Each key can have a custom expiration date
account.createKeyToAccess: Create a key to access UCM API

acme.title: Protocolo ACME
acme.noAccountsDesc: Crie a sua primeira conta ACME
acme.noCertificatesDesc: Os certificados emitidos via ACME aparecerão aqui
acme.enableAcmeServerDesc: Permitir emissão automática de certificados via ACME
acme.enableLetsEncryptProxyDesc: Forward requests to Let's Encrypt with audit logging
acme.emailRequired: Required for Let's Encrypt account registration
acme.aboutAcmeDesc: ACME enables automated certificate issuance. Configure the server below, then use the directory URL with any ACME client (certbot, acme.sh, etc.).
acme.aboutAcmeInfo: ACME (Automatic Certificate Management Environment) enables automated certificate issuance. Compatible with certbot, acme.sh, and other ACME clients.
acme.letsEncryptProxyTip: Enable the LE Proxy to forward requests to Let's Encrypt while maintaining centralized audit logging and control.
acme.accountSecurityWarning: ACME accounts contain private keys. Deactivate or delete unused accounts to minimize security exposure.
acme.agreeToTerms: I agree to the ACME Terms of Service
acme.agreeToTermsRequired: You must agree to the Terms of Service
acme.contactEmailHelper: Contact email for certificate expiry notifications

auth.signInToContinue: Inicie sessão para continuar para UCM
auth.clickToContinue: Clique para continuar para sua conta

cas.title: Autoridades de certificação
cas.createFirst: Crie a sua primeira CA para começar
cas.confirmDelete: Tem a certeza que pretende eliminar esta CA?
cas.selectToView: Selecione uma CA para ver detalhes
cas.p12PasswordDescription: Introduza palavra-passe para proteger o ficheiro PKCS#12.
cas.subject: Sujeito

certificates.title: Certificados
certificates.subject: Assunto
certificates.confirmRevoke: Tem a certeza que pretende revogar este certificado?
certificates.confirmRenew: Tem a certeza que pretende renovar este certificado?

common.name: Nome
common.confirmDelete: Tem a certeza que pretende eliminar?
common.selectToView: Selecione uma entrada para ver detalhes
common.deleteOlderThanDays: Eliminar registos mais antigos que os dias especificados.

crlOcsp.title: CRL e OCSP
crlOcsp.subtitle: {{count}} CRLs ativas
crlOcsp.selectCA: Selecione uma CA para gerir CRLs
crlOcsp.createCAFirst: Create a CA first to manage CRLs
crlOcsp.crlDescription: Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) contain serial numbers of revoked certificates. They are periodically published and cached by clients for offline verification.
crlOcsp.ocspVsCRLDescription: OCSP provides real-time revocation status checks. CRL is a periodic snapshot. Enable both for maximum compatibility with all clients and applications.
crlOcsp.cdpNoteDescription: Include CDP (CRL Distribution Point) and AIA (Authority Information Access) URLs in your CA settings to enable automatic revocation checking.
crlOcsp.includeURLsNote: Include these URLs in CA settings for automatic revocation checking.

csrs.title: Pedidos de assinatura de certificado
csrs.pasteCSR: Cole o CSR codificado em PEM aqui
csrs.passphraseHint: Leave empty if key is not encrypted
csrs.signCSRDescription: Sign this CSR with a Certificate Authority to issue a certificate
csrs.uploadCSRDescription: Upload a Certificate Signing Request file (.pem, .csr)
csrs.pasteCSRDescription: Paste your CSR in PEM format below
csrs.signToSee: Assine uma CSR para a ver aqui
csrs.selectCSR: Selecione uma CSR para ver detalhes
csrs.subject: Subject
csrs.aboutCSRsDescription: A Certificate Signing Request contains the public key and identity information needed to issue a certificate.
csrs.workflowSteps: 1. Upload CSR → 2. Review details → 3. Sign with CA → 4. Certificate issued
csrs.csrPEMError: Please paste a CSR in PEM format
csrs.invalidCSRFormat: Invalid CSR format. Must be in PEM format (-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----)
csrs.invalidKeyFormat: Invalid private key format - must be PEM format

hsm.title: Gestão de HSM
hsm.subtitle: {{count}} provider
hsm.noHSMDescription: Configure hardware security modules for key storage
hsm.selectProvider: Select a provider to view details
hsm.helpSecurity: HSM keys are in tamper-resistant hardware. Destroying a key is irreversible.
hsm.helpBestPractice: Use HSM for all CA signing keys. Test connections regularly.

smartImport.title: Smart Import
smartImport.description: Import certificates, keys, CSRs, and chains from any format

export.allCertsDesc: Download all certificates in a single file
export.individualExportHint: Use individual certificate export for DER, PKCS#12, or PFX formats
export.individualCAExportHint: Use individual CA export for DER, PKCS#12, or PFX formats

members.dragOrUseButtons: Drag users between lists or use the buttons

notifications.networkError: Erro de rede. Verifique a sua ligação.
notifications.certificatesExpiredAndExpiring: {{expired}} certificado(s) expirado(s) e {{expiring}} expirando em breve

password.securityReason: For security reasons, you must change your password before continuing.
password.minLength: Password must be at least 8 characters
password.mustBeDifferent: New password must be different from current

rbac.title: Controlo de acesso baseado em funções
rbac.subtitle: {{count}} role
rbac.noRolesDescription: Create custom roles for granular access control
rbac.selectRole: Select a role to view permissions
rbac.helpInfo: Define granular permissions per role. System roles are read-only.
rbac.helpSystemRoles: Built-in roles (admin, operator, viewer) cannot be modified.

scep.title: Protocolo SCEP
scep.noRequestsDesc: Enrollment requests will appear here when devices request certificates via SCEP protocol
scep.selectRequest: Select a request to view details
scep.subject: Subject
scep.enableScepDesc: Permitir aos dispositivos inscreverem-se via SCEP
scep.useThisUrl: Use this URL in client configuration
scep.caIdentifierHelp: Identifier sent to clients during GetCACaps
scep.autoApproveWarning: Auto-approve enabled. Ensure challenge passwords are securely distributed.
scep.scepDisabledDesc: Enable SCEP in Configuration tab to use challenge passwords.
scep.noCasAvailableDesc: Create a Certificate Authority first to configure SCEP challenge passwords
scep.aboutScepDesc: Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) enables automated certificate enrollment for devices like MDM-managed devices, network equipment, and IoT devices.
scep.mdmIntegrationDesc: Compatible with Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, VMware Workspace ONE, and other MDM solutions. Configure the SCEP URL and challenge password in your MDM profile.
scep.challengeSecurityDesc: Challenge passwords should be securely distributed. Consider using auto-approve only in trusted environments with proper network segmentation.

securityDashboard.title: Painel de segurança
securityDashboard.subtitle: Monitor security status and manage secrets

secrets.rotationSuccess: New secret generated - follow instructions to apply

audit.description: Audit logs use a cryptographic hash chain. Each entry contains a hash of the previous entry, making it impossible to modify or delete logs without detection.

session.clickToContinue: Click below to continue working, or you'll be logged out automatically.

settings.title: Definições
settings.subtitle: Configuração do sistema
settings.systemNameHelper: Nome de exibição do sistema UCM
settings.baseUrlHelper: Public URL of this UCM instance
settings.colorThemeDesc: Escolha um esquema de cores de sua preferência
settings.appearanceModeDesc: Controle como o brilho da interface se adapta
settings.followSystemDesc: Alternar automaticamente com base nas configurações do seu SO
settings.layoutModeDesc: Controle o comportamento do layout responsivo para janelas menores
settings.mobileLayoutActivates: O layout móvel é ativado abaixo de {{breakpoint}}px (atual: {{current}}px)
settings.settingSavedInBrowser: Esta configuração é salva no seu navegador e persiste entre as sessões.
settings.generalSubtitle: Nome do sistema, URL, configuração de fuso horário
settings.emailSubtitle: Configuração do servidor SMTP para notificações
settings.enforce2faDesc: Exigir que todos os usuários habilitem 2FA
settings.backupSubtitle: Opções de backup e recuperação de dados
settings.autoBackupPasswordHelper: Senha usada para criptografar backups automáticos
settings.noBackupsHint: Crie um backup para proteger seus dados
settings.restoreFromBackupDesc: Carregue um arquivo .ucmbkp para restaurar todos os dados
settings.selectBackupFile: Selecione o arquivo de backup (.ucmbkp criptografado)
settings.createBackupDesc: Crie um backup contendo todos os dados (banco de dados, certificados, CAs, usuários, configuração). O backup será criptografado com sua senha.
settings.encryptionPasswordHelper: Use uma senha forte - você precisará dela para restaurar o backup
settings.restoreWarning: Isso SUBSTITUIRÁ TODOS os dados atuais pelo conteúdo do backup. Esta ação não pode ser desfeita.
settings.enterBackupPassword: Digite a senha usada para criar o backup
settings.enableAuditLoggingDesc: Registrar todas as atividades do sistema
settings.databaseSubtitle: Estatísticas e manutenção do banco de dados
settings.databaseResetDesc: Redefina o banco de dados para o estado inicial. Isso EXCLUIRÁ TODOS os certificados, CAs, usuários e configurações.
settings.useUcmCertificateDesc: Aplique um certificado existente do UCM como certificado HTTPS. Apenas certificados válidos com chaves privadas são mostrados.
settings.noValidCertificates: Nenhum certificado válido com chaves privadas encontrado. Emita um certificado primeiro.
settings.regenerateCertificateDesc: Gere um novo certificado HTTPS autoassinado. O servidor será reiniciado automaticamente.
settings.applyCustomCertificateDesc: Carregue seu próprio certificado e chave privada (formato PEM).
settings.selectCertOrKeyFile: Selecione o arquivo de certificado ou chave (formato PEM)
settings.featureComingSoon: Recurso em breve: Carregar certificado HTTPS personalizado
settings.updatesSubtitle: Verificar e instalar atualizações do UCM

templates.title: Modelos
templates.selectTemplate: Selecione um modelo para ver detalhes
templates.aboutTemplatesDescription: Certificate templates define default values for certificate issuance. Use them to standardize certificate properties across your organization.
templates.keyUsageWarning: Ensure Key Usage and Extended Key Usage match your certificate's intended purpose.
templates.importDescription: Import a certificate template from a JSON file or paste JSON content

tools.title: Ferramentas de certificados
tools.subtitle: SSL checker, decoders, converters and key matcher
tools.sslCheckerDesc: Check SSL certificate of a remote server
tools.converterDesc: Convert between PEM, DER, PKCS12, PKCS7
tools.keyMatcherDesc: Verify if key, certificate and CSR match
tools.supportsFormats: Supports: PEM, DER, CRT, CER, P12/PFX, P7B, KEY, CSR
tools.privateKeyFile: Private Key File (optional if included in input)
tools.pleaseProvideItem: Please provide at least one item to match
tools.pleaseUploadOrPaste: Please upload a file or paste content to convert
tools.privateKeyRequired: Private key is required for PKCS12 conversion
tools.helpDescription: A collection of SSL/TLS tools to help you troubleshoot, verify, decode and convert certificates.
tools.helpSslChecker: Enter a hostname to check its SSL certificate. Shows validity, expiry, cipher suite, TLS version, and any issues like mismatched hostnames or expired certificates.
tools.helpCsrDecoder: Paste a CSR (Certificate Signing Request) in PEM format to see its contents including subject, public key type/size, and any requested extensions like SANs.
tools.helpCertDecoder: Paste a certificate in PEM format to see all details: subject, issuer, validity dates, extensions, key usage, fingerprints, and more.
tools.helpKeyMatcher: Verify that a private key, certificate, and/or CSR belong together by comparing their public keys. Useful before installing certificates.
tools.helpConverter: Convert certificates and keys between formats: PEM ↔ DER, PEM → PKCS12 (requires key), PEM → PKCS7. Download the converted file directly.

trustStore.title: Loja de confiança
trustStore.subtitle: {{count}} certificado
trustStore.addCertificatesForChain: Add certificates to validate certificate chains
trustStore.selectToView: Selecione um certificado para ver detalhes
trustStore.subject: Subject
trustStore.name: Name
trustStore.syncConfirm: This will import up to 50 certificates from the system CA bundle (/etc/ssl/certs). Continue?
trustStore.aboutTrustStoreDesc: The Trust Store contains certificates that are explicitly trusted for validating certificate chains. Add Root and Intermediate CAs here for chain verification.
trustStore.bestPracticesDesc: Only add certificates from trusted sources. Regularly review and remove expired or unnecessary certificates to maintain security.
trustStore.securityNoteDesc: Certificates in the Trust Store can validate any certificate chain. Be careful when adding third-party certificates.
